question_html:
Consider the following functionaries:

1. Cabinet Secretary.

2. Chief Election Commissioner

3. Union Cabinet Ministers

4. Chief Justice of India

Their correct sequence in the order of precedence is :
explanation_html: • The order of Precedence of the functionaries given in the optional are – Chief Justice of India > Cabinet Minister of the Union > Chief Election Commissioner > Cabinet Secretary.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is incorrect ?
option_b: (b)  Diu is an island in the Gulf of Khambhat
option_c: (c)  Daman and Diu were separated from Goa by the 56th Amendment of the Constitution of India
option_d: (d)  Dadra and Nagar Haveli were under French colonial rule till 1954
explanation_html: • Dadra and Nagar Haveli were under the Colonial Rule of the Portuguese (but not the French) until its liberation in 1954.

question_html: The Speaker can ask a member of the House to stop speaking and let another member speak. This phenomenon is known as:
explanation_html: • Decorum = Parliamentary etiquette. Crossing the floor = Changing the party. Interpolation = Seeking clarification through ruling. Yielding the floor = Respecting Speaker’s order.

question_html: Which one of the following statements about a Money Bill is not correct ?
option_a: (a) A Money Bill can be tabled in either House of Parliament.
option_b: (b) The Speaker of Lok Sabha is the final authority to decide whether a Bill is a Money Bill or not.
option_c: (c) The Rajya Sabha must return a Money Bill passed by the Lok Sabha and send it for consideration within 14 days.
option_d: (d) The President cannot return a Money Bill to the Lok Sabha for reconsideration.
explanation_html: • A money bill can be tabled in Lok Sabha only and it shall not be introduced in the council of states (Rajya Sabha). A bill shall be deemed to be a Money Bill if it contains only provisions dealing with all or any of the matters mentioned under Article – 110 of the Constitution.

question_html: A college student desires to get elected to the Municipal Council of his city. The validity of his nomination would depend on the important condition, among others, that
option_a: (a)  He obtains permission from the Principal of his college
option_b: (b)  He is a member of a political party
option_c: (c)  His name figures in the Voter’s List
option_d: (d)  He files a declaration owing allegiance to the Constitution of India
explanation_html: • The validity of nomination of a person to get elected to the Municipal Council would depend on the condition that his name should be figured in the Voter’s list.

question_html: The Parliament can make any law for the whole or any part of India for implementing International treaties :
option_a: (a)  With the consent of all the States
option_b: (b)  With the consent of the majority of States
option_c: (c)  With the consent of the States concerned
option_d: (d)  Without the consent of any state
explanation_html: • Article 253 – Parliament has power to make any law for the whole or any part of the territory of India for implementing any treaty, agreement or convention with any other country(ies) without the consent of any state.

question_html:
Consider the following statements about the Attorney General of India:

  1. He is appointed by the President of India.
  2. He must have the same qualifications as are required for a Judge of the Supreme Court.
  3. He must be a member of either House of Parliament.
  4. He can be removed by impeachment of Parliament.

    Which of these statement are correct ?
explanation_html: • Article 76 of the Constitution says about Attorney General of India. The President shall appoint a person who is qualified to be appointed a Judge of the Supreme Court. He may not be a member of Parliament. He holds office during the pleasure of the President.

question_html: The state which has the largest number of seats reserved for the Scheduled Tribes in the Lok Sabha is:
explanation_html: • (In the given options) Madhya Pradesh, with 5 seats, has the largest number of seats reserved for the Scheduled Tribes in the Lok Sabha. (Bihar and Uttar Pradesh have no seats reserved for STs, Gujarat has 4 seats).

question_html: The primary function of the Finance Commission in India is to _____
option_a: (a) Recommend the distribution of revenue between the Centre and the States.
option_c: (c) Advise the President on financial matters.
option_d: (d) Allocate funds to various ministries of the Union and State Governments.
explanation_html: The Finance Commission can only advise the President on financial matters, such as the distribution of the net proceeds of taxes between the Union and the States, the principles which should govern the grants-in-aid of the revenues of the States, etc.

question_html:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists :

List I                                                                                         List II

(Local bodies)                                                                (States a in 1999)

A. Zilla Parishads at the sub-divisional level              1. Andhra Pradesh

B. Mandal Praja Parishad.                                             2. Assam

C. Tribal Councils.                                                           3. Mizoram

D. Absence of Village Panchayats.                               4. Meghalaya
explanation_html: • Zilla Parishad at the sub-divisional level – Assam, Mandal Praja Parishad – Andhra Pradesh Tribal Councils – Meghalaya Absence of Village Panchayats - Mizoram.

question_html: The 73rd Constitution Amendment Act 1992 refers to the
option_a: (a)  Generation of gainful employment for the unemployed and the under employed men and women in rural area
option_b: (b)  Generation of employment for the able bodied adults who are in need and desirous of work during the lean agricultural season
option_c: (c)  Laying the foundation for strong and vibrant Panchayati Raj Institutions in the county
option_d: (d)  Guarantee of right to life, liberty and security of person, equality before law and equal protection without discrimination
explanation_html: • The 73rd Amendment Act 1992 refers to the laying of the foundation for strong and vibrant Panchayati Raj Institutions in the country, and to organize village panchayat to function as units of the constitution.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. Tides are the great help in navigation and fishing.

2. High tide enables big ships to enter or leave the harbour safely.

3. Tide prevents siltation in the harbours.

4. Kandla and Diamond Harbour are tidal ports.

Which of these statements are correct ?
explanation_html: All the four statements are correct. Kandla in Gujarat, Diamond Harbour in Calcutta are tidal ports.

question_html:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

      List I (Oceanic Trench)                List II (Location)

    A. Aleutian                                   1. Indian Ocean

    B. Kermadec                                2. North Pacific Ocean

    C. Sunda                                       3. South Pacific Ocean

    D. S. Sandwich                             4. South Atlantic Ocean
explanation_html: A – Aleutian trench in North Pacific Ocean near Bering Sea B – Kermadec trench in South Pacific Ocean near New Zealand C – Sunda trench in Indian Ocean near Sumatra Island D – South Sandwich trench in Atlantic Ocean.

question_html:
Assertion (A): The frequency of floods in North Indian plains has increased during the last couple of decades.

Reason (R): There has been reduction in the depth of river valleys due to deposition of silt.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Frequency of floods in North Indian plains increased due to reduction in depth of valleys by silt deposition.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is not true ?
option_a: (a)  Ghaggar"s water is utilized in the Indira Gandhi Canal
option_c: (c)  Nizam Sagar is situated on the Manjira river
option_d: (d)  Penganga is a tributary of the Godavari
explanation_html: • Indira Gandhi Canal starts from the confluence of Sutlej and Beas river in Punjab, and flows through Rajasthan. It receives water from Sutlej and Beas rivers.

question_html: Along which one of the following meridians did India experience the first light of the sunrise of the new millennium?
explanation_html: In the given optional 92030’ E is the easternmost point in India. So it experienced the first light of the sunrise of the new millennium.

question_html:
Consider the following provinces of former Yugoslavia :

1. Bosnia

2. Croatia

3. Slovenia

4. Yugoslavia

The correct sequence of these provinces from the east to the west is :
explanation_html: The correct sequence from East to West is Yugoslavia, Bosnia Herzgovina, Croatia, Slovenia. These were former Yugoslavia provinces and divided in 1999.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is false?
option_a: (a)  All countries other than India have over 80% literacy
option_b: (b)  Malaysia and Korea have life expectancy higher than all other countries
option_c: (c)  Higher the adult literacy lower is the infant mortality
option_d: (d)  The life expectancy at birth in India is almost the same as that of Indonesia

question_html:
Assertion (A): Ganga Plain is the most densely populated part of India.

Reason (R): Ganga is the most harnessed river of India.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Cauvery is the most harnessed river of India.

question_html:
Consider the following statements about the megacities of India :

1. Population of each megacity is more than 5 million.

2. All the megacities are importance sea ports.

3. Megacities are either national or state capitals.

Which of the statements given above are correct ?
explanation_html: Statements 1 and 3 are correct. Urban agglomerations, with over five million population are called Mega cities. These are six – Greater Mumbai, Kolkata, Delhi, Chennai, Bangalore and Hyderabad. Delhi is N.C.T. and remaining cities are state capitals.

question_html: Which one of the following pairs of primitive tribes and places of their inhabitation is NOT correctly matched?
explanation_html: • Primitive Tribal Groups (PTGs) are Scheduled Tribes known for their declining or stagnant population, low levels of literacy, pre-agricultural technology, primarily belonging to the hunting and gathering stage, and extreme backwardness. There are 75 PTGs spread over 15 states and UT's.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is true according to 1991 census data?
option_a: (a)  U.P. has the highest density of population in India
option_b: (b)  Himachal Pradesh has the highest female to male sex ratio in India
option_c: (c)  West Bengal has the highest growth rate of population in India
option_d: (d)  Bihar has the lowest literacy rate in India
explanation_html:
﻿

According to 2001 Census, Highest population density is in West Bengal (904). Sex ratio is highe in Kerala (1058). Highest growth rate of population is in Nagaland (64.415). Bihar has the lowest literacy rate (47.43%). Hence, ‘d’ is correct.

question_html: Which one of the following ports of India handles the highest tonnage of import cargo?
explanation_html: Kandla handles the highest tonnage of import cargo.

question_html:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists :

      List I                                                            List II

(Minerals)                                               (Major producer)

A. Mineral Oil                                  1. Zambia

B. Copper                                         2. Guyana

C. Manganese                                 3. Venezuela

D. Bauxite                                        4. Gabon
explanation_html: The major producer of Mineral oil is Venezuela. The major producer of Copper is Zambia in Africa, (also Chile in South America). The major producer of Manganese is Gabon. The major producer of Bauxite is Guyana.

question_html: Which one of the following lakes forms an international boundary between Tanzania and Uganda ?
explanation_html: Lake Victoria (Biggest lake in Africa) forms the international boundary between Tanzania (South) and Uganda (North).

question_html: The correct sequence in decreasing order of the four sugarcane producing States in India is :
option_a: (a)  Maharashtra, U.P., Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh
option_b: (b)  U.P., Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh
option_c: (c)  Maharashtra, U.P., Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu
option_d: (d)  U.P., Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu
explanation_html: The correct sequence in decreasing order of the Sugarcane producing states is U.P. > Maharashtra > Tamil Nadu > Andhra Pradesh. U.P. is the largest producing state of Sugarcane in India.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. Maharashtra has the highest acreage under jawar in India.

2. Gujarat is the largest producer of groundnut in India.

3. Rajasthan has the largest area of cultivable wasteland in India.

4. Andhra Pradesh has the highest per hectare yield of maize in India.

Which of the statements given above are correct?
explanation_html: • 1, 3 statements are correct. Because Andhra Pradesh is the largest producer of Groundnut in India.

question_html:
Assertion (A): In Australia, cattle rearing is done more for meat than for milk.

Reason (R): Australians are traditionally non-vegetarians.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Both A and R are correct. But R is not the correct reason for A. Though they are traditionally non-vegetarian, they rear cattle for meat, for exporting.

question_html: Which one of the following is knows as the “Coffee port” of the world ?
explanation_html: ‘Santos’ is considered as the “Coffee port” of the world. It is in Brazil. It is also an out port of Sao Paulo.

question_html: A ‘black hole’ is a body in space which does not allow any radiation to come out. This properly is due to its
explanation_html: Because of its high density, a black hole has very high gravitational force. So no object, whether it is particle or light, can escape from it.

question_html:
Assertion (A): The origin of Feudal system in Ancient India can be traced to Military campaigns.

Reason (R): There was considerable expansion of the Feudal system during the Gupta period.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: The origin of feudal system can be traced back to landgrants given by Satavahanas. The feudal system considerably expanded during the Gupta period.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Ashoka annexed Kalinga to the Mauryan Empire.

Reason (R): Kalinga controlled land and sea routes to South India.
option_a: (a) Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b) Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c) A is true but R is false
option_d: (d) A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Kalinga controlled land and sea routes to South India hence it was annexed to Mauryan empire by Ashoka.

question_html:
Assertion (A): The emphasis of Jainism on non-violence (ahimsa) prevented agriculturalists from embracing Jainism.

Reason (R): Cultivation involved killing of insects and pests.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Agriculturalists were prevented from embracing Jainism as cultivation involves killing of insects and pests which is against the principle of non-violence (ahimsa) of Jainism.

question_html: The practice of military governorship was first introduced in India by the
explanation_html: The practice of military governorship was first introduced in India by Greeks. Alexander in his return journey from India, distributed his possessions among his military generals. The military governors are called ‘strategos’.

question_html: Which one of the following dynasties was ruling over North India at the time of Alexander’s invasion?
explanation_html: Nanda dynasty was ruling over North India at the time of Alexander’s invasion. Nanda’s were later deposed by Chandragupta Maurya with the help of Kautilya.

question_html: The Swarna Jayanti Shahari Rozgar Yojana which came into operation from 1-12-1997 aims to provide gainful employment to the urban unemployment or underemployment poor but does not include
option_c: (c)  Prime Minister’s Integrate Urban Poverty Eradication Programme
explanation_html: The Swarna Jayanti Shahari Rozgar Yojana doesn’t include ‘Nehru Rozgar Yojana’.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

The Indian rupee is fully convertible

  1. In respect of Current Account of Balance of Payment
  2. In respect of Capital Account of Balance of Payment
  3. Into gold

Which of the statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: • The Indian rupee is fully convertible in respect of current account of Balance of payment. Tarapore Committee recommended for full convertibility of rupee i.e. both current and capital account convertibility.

question_html: Resurgent India Bonds was issued in US Dollar, Pound, Sterling and
explanation_html: The Resurgent Bonds were issued in US Dollar, Pound, Sterling and Japanese Yen.

question_html:
Consider the following statements: The Ministerial Meeting of WTO held in December 1999 was unsuccessful because it attempted to link trade with 

1. Labour related issues.

2. Environment related issues.

3. Terrorism related issues.

4. Debt related issues.

Which of these statements are correct ?
explanation_html: • The Ministerial Meeting of WTO (1999) was unsuccessful because it attempted to link trade with labour related issues and environment related issues.

question_html: The growth rate of per capita income at current prices is higher than that of per capita income at constant prices, because the latter takes into account the rate of
explanation_html: The growth rate of per capita income at current prices is higher than that of PCI at constant prices because the latter takes into account the rate of increase in price level.

question_html: A rise in ‘SENSEX’ means
option_a: (a)  A rise in prices of states of all companies registered with Bombay Stock Exchange
option_b: (b)  A rise in prices of shares of all companies registered with National Stock Exchange
option_c: (c)  An overall rise in prices of shares of group of companies registered with Bombay Stock Exchange
option_d: (d)  A rise in prices of shares of all companies belonging to a group of companies registered with Bombay Stock Exchange
explanation_html: A rise in ‘SENSEX’ means an overall rise in prices of shares of group of companies registered with Bombay Stock Exchange.

question_html:
Match List I with List II and select correct answer using the codes given below the lists:                                                                                                                                             List I                                                                 List II

A. Boom.                1. Business activity at high level with increasing income, output and employment at macro level

B. Recession          2. Gradual fall of income, output and employment with business activity in a low gear

C. Depression        3. Unprecedented level of under employment and unemployment, drastic fall in income, output and employment

D. Recovery           4. Steady rise in the general level of prices, income, output and employment
explanation_html:
A. Boom – Business activity at high level with increasing income, output and employment at macro level.                                  

B. Recession – Gradual fall of income, output and employment with business activity in a low gear.                                            

C. Depression – Unprecedented level of under employment and unemployment, drastic fall in income, output and employment.                                                                                                                                                                                                  

D. Recovery – Steady rise in the general level of prices, income, output and employment.

question_html: Assertion (A): The rate of growth of India’s exports has shown an appreciable increase after 1991.                                                           Reason (R): The Govt. of India has resorted to devaluation.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: The Government of India resorted to devaluation in the year 1991 which led to increase in exports. Devaluation lowers the prices of domestic goods in the international market. Along with this some export promotion schemes were initiated to enhance the export growth rate in India.

question_html: “instill into the vast millions of workers, men and women, who actually do the job, a sense of partnership and of cooperative performance………………” The above passage related to
explanation_html: The above passage relates to Community Development Programme. It was started in 1952 with an aim of overall development of rural areas.

question_html: Indian Human Development Report does not give for each sample village
explanation_html: Indian Human Development Report was first initiated in 2001 by the former Deputy Chairman of Planning Commission ‘K.C. Pant’ which includes indicators on Education, Health, Economic well being and access to amenities.

question_html:
Consider the following statements regarding the Chakiarkoothu form of dance :

  1. It is performed by Chakiar caste.
  2. It cannot be traditionally witnessed by the higher caste Hindus.
  3. Mizhavu is the accompanying instrument.
  4.  Its theatre form is called koothambalam.

Which of the statements given above is/are correct ?
explanation_html: • Chakiarkoothu is a famous folk dance of Kerala performed by Chakiar caste. Mizhavu is not associated with this dance.

question_html:
Assertion (A): The Aham and Puram poems of the Padinen Kulukanakku group formed a continuation of the Sangam composition.

Reason (R): They were included under the Post-Sangam works as against the Sangam works proper.

Assertion (A): The Aham and Puram poems of the Padinen Kulukanakku group formed a continuation of the Sangam composition. Reason (R): They were included under the Post-Sangam works as against the Sangam works proper.
option_a: (a) Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b) Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c) A is true but R is false
option_d: (d) A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • Kilukanakku forms the didactic group of Sangam literature.

question_html: Which one of the following pairs is not correctly matched?
explanation_html: • 'Giddha' is written by 'Vijay Tendulkar'.

question_html: The Raga which is sung early in the morning is
explanation_html: • Togo is the Raga which is sung early in the morning.

question_html: Which one of the following Muslim rulers was hailed as the ‘Jagadguru’ by his Muslim subjects because of his belief in secularism?
explanation_html: Ibrahim Adil Shah was called ‘Jagadguru’ and ‘Adilbaba’ by his people because of his belief in Secularism.

question_html: Who among the following streamlined the Maratha administration after Sambhaji ?
explanation_html: Peshwa Balaji Viswanah streamlined the Maratha administration after Sambhaji.

question_html:
Match List-I with List-II and select the correct answer using the codes given the lists :

List-I                           List-II

A. Iqta.                   1. Marathas

B. Jagir.                   2. Delhi Sultans

C. Amaram.            3. Mughals

D. Mokasa.             4. Vijayanagara
explanation_html:
These were all land grants.
Iqta – Delhi Sultans, Jagir – Mughals
Amaram – Vijayanagara rulers, Mokasa – Marathas

question_html: “In this instance we could not play off the Mohammedans against the Hindus.” To which one of the following events did this remark of Aitchison relate ?
explanation_html: During the Khilafat and Non-Cooperation Movement period, Muslims joined with Hindus to struggle against the common enemy British. This period had seen unprecedented unity between these two religions. This forced Aitchison to make the above statement.

question_html: The Indian National Army (I.N.A.) came into existence in 1943 in
explanation_html: Though INA was formed by Captain Mohan Singh, on 1 September 1942, it was failed and came into existence again on 2 July 1943, when Subhash Chandra Bose reached Singapore and gave the rousing war cry of “Dilli Chalo”.

question_html: The last major extension of British Indian territory took place during the time of
explanation_html: Dalhousie (1849-56) introduced the ‘Doctrine of Lapse’ which proved fatal for the princely states. Based on this, he annexed a lot of States and expanded the British Indian territory to a large extent.

question_html: As an alternative to the partition of India, Gandhiji suggested to Mountbatten that he
option_b: (b)  Invite Jinnah to form the government
option_c: (c)  Invite Nehru and Jinnah to form the government together
option_d: (d)  Invite the army to take over for some time
explanation_html: Gandhiji, as an alternative to the partition of India, suggested to Mountbatten to invite Jinnah to form the Government. But it was opposed by Congress as well as Muslim League.

question_html: The native state of Tripura became involved in the Freedom movement early in the 20th century because
option_a: (a)  The kings of Tripura were always anti-British
option_b: (b)  The Bengal revolutionaries took shelter in Tripura
option_c: (c)  The tribes of the state were fiercely freedom loving
option_d: (d)  There were already some groups fighting against the kingship ‘and its protector, the British
explanation_html: Tripura became involved in the freedom struggle early in the 20th century because there were already some groups (Bengal revolutionary armies) who were fighting against the Kingship ‘and its protector, the British.

question_html: After returning from South Africa, Gandhiji launched his first successful Satyagraha in
explanation_html: In 1915, Gandhiji returned from South Africa, and in 1917, at Champaran (Bihar) he experimented the Satyagraha to alleviate the problems of indigo cultivators.

question_html:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

     List I                                                    List II

A. Chittagong Armoury Raid       1. Kalpana Dutt

B. Abhinav Bharat                         2. Guru Ram Singh

C. Anushilan Samiti                      3. Vinayak Damodar Savarkar

D. Kuka Movement                      4. Aurobindo Ghosh
explanation_html: Kalpana Dutt and Preeti Lata Waddedar were associated with Chittagong Armoury Raid in 1930, under the leadership of Surya Sen. Abhinav Bharat was as revolutionary organisation founded by V.D. Savarkar in 1904, Aurobindo Ghosh was associated with Anushilan Samiti, which was founded by Sisir Kumar Ghosh in Bengal. Kuka Rebellious movement was organized by Ram Singh in Punjab in 1863.

question_html:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

         List I                                                                                                                                  List II

A. Land allotted to big feudal landlords                                                                     1. Jagirdari System

B. Land allotted to revenue farmers or rent collectors                                               2. Ryotwari System

C. Land allotted to each peasant with the right to sublet, mortgage, gift or sell        3. Mahalwari

D. Revenue settlements made at village level                                                          4. Zamindari System
explanation_html: The system in which Land allotted to a big landlord was called Jagirdari System, (jagirdar = landlord). The system in which land allotted to revenue farmers of rent collectors (Zamindars) was Zamindari System. The land allotted to each peasant with the right to sublet, mortgage transfer, girt or sell was called as Ryotwari System, as individual farmer had the owning rights. (Mahal = Village) If revenue settlement was made at village level, then it was called as Mahalwari System.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Lord Linlithgow describe the August Movement of 1942 as the most serious revolt after the Sepoy mutiny.

Reason (R): Peasants joined the movement in large number in some places.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: The Quit India Movement which was started on 8 August, 1942 had, unprecedent involvement of peasant community which made the struggle more fierce. Thus Lord Linlithgow described this movement as the most serious rebellion since Sepoy Mutiny.

question_html:
Assertion (A): The basic weakness of the early nationalist movement lay in its narrow social base.

Reason (R): It fought for the narrow interests of the social groups which joined it.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Early nationalists fought for the rights of the common man also. The reason for narrow social base of the early Nationalist movement was, the organization in those starting days was weak and at any point the British could crush it. So, leaders confined to mere prayers and petitions.

question_html: While delivering the presidential address, the Congress President who advocated the introduction of Roman script for Hindi language was:
explanation_html: It was Subhash Chandra Bose during his Presidential address in 1938, advocated the introduction of Roman Script for Hindu Language..

question_html: At the time of partition of India, which one of the following provinces of British India came forward with a plan for a united and independent existence?
explanation_html: During the Partition of India, Punjab province came forward with a plan for a United and Independent existent. But due to Sardar Vallabh Bhai Patel’s effort, Patiala and East Punjab States Union (PEPSU) became a part of Indian Union.

question_html: The Balkan Plan for fragmentation of India was the brain–child of
explanation_html: British Government authorized Lord Mountbatten to resolve the situation as early as possible. It is he who felt that the situation had deteriorated so much, that the creation of Pakistan appeared inevitable.

question_html:
Consider the following statements about the Indian National Congress:

1. Sarojini Naidu was the first woman to be the President of the Congress

2. C.R. Das was in prison when he functioned as the President of the Congress

3. The first Britisher to become the President of the Congress was Alan Octavian Hume

4. Alfred Webb was the President of the Congress in 1894 

Which of the statements given above are correct?
explanation_html: Sarojini Naidu was second woman to preside over the Congress in 1925, first woman was Annie Besant in 1917, C. R. Das presided over Congress from Prison in 1921. A.O. Hume was the founder of Indian National Congress. But he never presided over the Congress. Sir Alfred Webb was the President of Madras Session of Congress in 1894.

question_html: Which one of the following is NOT a feature of the Government of India Act of 1935 ?
option_a: (a)  Diarchy at the Centre as well as in the provinces
explanation_html: Diarchy was introduced at the centre but not in the provinces. Diarchy was introduced in the province through GOI act, 1919 but it was abolished by the GOI act, 1935.

question_html: Gild-edged market means
explanation_html: Gilt edged market means the market of Government securities. They are Gilt edged because it is certain that interest will be paid and they will be redeemed on the due date.

option_d: (d)  Y = C + I – G + X – M

explanation_html: For the first time in 1867-68, Dada Bhai Naoroji had ascertained the per capita income, in his book “poverty and un-British rule in India”, as Rs. 20/-

Which one of the following does a TV remote control unit use to operate a TV set ?
explanation_html: Radio waves are used to transmit radio and T.V. signals.

question_html: A noise level of 100 decibels would correspond to
explanation_html:
Decibel is an unit for measurement of sound intensity.
 Noise    Level (decibel)
 Whispering  : 20
 Normal talk  : 40-60
 Vehicle horn  : 90
 Machine’s sound : 100
 Supersonic plane’s sound: 120

question_html: Fluorescent tubes are fitted with a choke. The choke oil
explanation_html: The choke oil steps up the line voltage. In a fluorescent tube (tube light) a starter is used which increases the current and sends it to the choke. The choke-oil increases the voltage of this current and sends it to tube light and the tube lights up. After this, the work of starter is completed and the choke oil is used to balance the voltage levels to save the tube from damage.

question_html: When a CD (compact disc used in audio and video systems) is seen in sunlight, rainbow like colours are seen. This can be explained on the basis of phenomenon of
explanation_html: The compact disc is transparent for light, as it is an ‘optical disc’. As light travels through the CD, all the three phenomena refraction, diffraction and transmission will result in rainbow like colours.

question_html:
Assertion (A): A man standing on a completely frictionless surface can propel himself by whistling.

Reason (R): If no external force acts on a system, its momentum cannot change.
option_a: (a) Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b) Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c) A is true but R is false
option_d: (d) A is false but R is true
explanation_html: By applying force in whistling on a frictionless surface a man can propel himself. As per the law of inertia, any object will remain at rest unless it experiences a force. Hence momentum cannot be changed unless an external force acts on the system.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Small glass beads fixed on traffic signals glow brightly when light falls upon them.

Reason (R): Light is totally reflected when the angle of incidence exceeds a certain critical value and light travelling in a denser medium is reflected from a rarer medium.
option_a: (a) Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b) Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c) A is true but R is false
option_d: (d) A is false but R is true
explanation_html: The small glass beads fixed on traffic signals glow brightly when light falls upon them due to total internal reflection which depends on critical angle.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Large cold storage plants use ammonia as refrigerant while domestic refrigerators use chlorofluoro-carbons.

Reason (R): Ammonia can be liquefied at ambient temperatures at low pressures.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true

question_html: Aluminium surfaces are often ‘anodized’. This means the deposition of a layer of
explanation_html: Due to less positive charge of zinc, aluminium rod attracts zinc from zinc solution and hence zinc oxide is deposited as a layer.

question_html:
Consider the following statements :

Hard water is not suitable for 

1. Drinking 

2. Washing clothes with soap

3. Use in boilers

4. Irrigating crops

Which of these statements are correct ?
explanation_html: Hardness of water is due to presence of bicarbonates, chlorides and sulphates of calcium and magnesium. It does not produce lather with soaps or detergents. When boiled, in the boilers, the salts of calcium and magnesium are deposited on the walls of the boilers.

question_html: A small pouch containing silica gel is often found in bottles of medicine in tablet or powder form because silica gel
option_d: (d)  Absorbs all gases present inside the bottle
explanation_html: Silica gel is found in bottles of medicine in tablet or powder form because it absorbs the moisture and thereby increase the storing life of medicine.

explanation_html: Nichrome is elastic in nature and also its melting point is high therefore it is very hard and very ductile both.

question_html: Most of the explosions in mines occur due to mixing of
explanation_html: Most of the explosions in mines occur due to the mixing of methane and air.

question_html: The sensation of fatigue in the muscles after prolonged strenuous physical work is caused by
option_a: (a)  A decrease in the supply of oxygen
option_b: (b)  Minor wear and tear of muscle fibres
explanation_html: Fatigue in muscles after prolonged strenuous physical work is due to the accumulation of lactic acid.

question_html: Canola refers to special type of oil seed mustard varieties bred for human consumption. The main characteristic of these varieties is that the
option_a: (a)  Seeds have very high oil content
option_b: (b)  Oil is rich in unsaturated fatty acids
option_d: (d)  Oil has very low Erucic acid content
explanation_html: ‘Canola’ are a special type of all seed mustard varieties bred for oil rich in unsaturated fatty acids.

question_html: Within biological communities, some species are important in determining the ability of a large number of other species to persists in the community. Such species are called
explanation_html:
Keystone species are important in determining the ability of a large number of other species to persist in the community. Allopatric species: species occupying mutually exclusive geographical areas.
 Sympatric species: different species that live in the same area but are prevented from successfully reproducing by a reproductive isolating mechanism.
 Threatened species: May become endangered species in the near future, if proper protection measures were not taken up.

question_html:
Assertion (A): In human beings, the females play a major role in determining the sex of the offspring.

Reason (R): Women have two ‘X’ chromosomes.
option_a: (a) Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b) Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c) A is true but R is false
option_d: (d) A is false but R is true
explanation_html: In human beings, ‘males’ play a major role in determining the sex of the offspring as they are heterosexual with one X and one Y chromosome.

question_html:
Assertion (A): “DNA Finger printing” has become a powerful tool to establish paternity and identity of criminals in rape and assault cases.

Reason (R): Trace evidences such as hair, saliva and dried semen are adequate for DNA analysis.
option_a: (a) Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b) Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c) A is true but R is false
option_d: (d) A is false but R is true
explanation_html: ‘DNA’ finger printing’ is a genetic diagnostic testing, in which DNA sample obtained from any of the suspects nucleated body sample (hairs, body fluid (saliva), dried semen, nail, skin etc.) is isolated, identified, analysed and imaged using artificial radioactive probes. It helps in establishing paternity, identification of criminals in rape and murder cases and also in detection of genetic disorders.

question_html:
Assertion (A): In a motion picture, usually 24 frames are projected every second over the whole length of the film.

Reason (R): An image formed on the retina of eye persists for about 0.1 s after the removal of stimulus.
option_a: (a) Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b) Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c) A is true but R is false
option_d: (d) A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A.

question_html: The ‘stones’ formed in human kidney consist mostly of
explanation_html: The stones formed in human kidney mostly consists of urates and calcium oxalate, mucopolysacharides, calcium carbonate. Urate and oxalate stones are most common.

question_html: Which one of the following organisms can serve as a biofertilizersfor rice crop?
explanation_html: Blue green algae (Cyano bacteria) and Azolla are used for the low land rice cultivation as algal bio-fertilizers. Fixes 20-30 kg N/ha per year in rice field. Ex.: Anabaena, Nostoc etc.

question_html: At which stage in its life cycle does the silk worm yield the fibre of commerce?
explanation_html: Pupa stage of Silkworm yield fibre of commerce. The larve while entering the pupal stage makes a pupal case around it by secreting a protein fibre (Fibroin).

question_html:
Match List I (Disease) with List II (Types of disease) and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

        List I                           List II

A. Haemophilia         1. Deficiency disease

B. Diabetes                2. Genetic disease

C. Rickets                   3. Hormonal disorder

D. Ringworm             4. Fungal infection
explanation_html:
Haemophili is X-linked recessive genetic disease.
 Diabetes is due to the low hormone (Insulin) levels in the blood which leads to high blood sugar levels.
 Rickets is due to the deficiency of Vitamin D in children.
 Ringworm is due to the fungal infections belong to a group called ‘Dermatophytes’. (Microsporum, Trichophyton).

question_html: Soft drinks such as colas contain significant quantifies of
explanation_html: Tannin

question_html: Insect-resistant cotton plants have been genetically engineered by inserting a gene from a/an
explanation_html: Transgenic cotton resistant to bollworm, (Heliothis armigera), a lepidopteran insect pest was developed by inserting a toxin gene (Cry 1 AC) taken from a bacterium (Bacillus thruingiensis). This transgenic cotton was released commercially in India as Bt cotton.

question_html: Hybridoma technology is a new biotechnological approach for commercial production of
explanation_html: Hybridoma technology is a new biotechnological approach for commercial production of Monoclonal antibodies which are highly specific to the including antigen, and are relatively cheaper.

question_html: The memory of a computer is commonly expressed in terms of kilobytes or Megabytes. A byte is made up of :
explanation_html: A byte is made up of eight binary digits (bit). Each number, letter, symbol etc. put into a computer is turned into a group of eight bits (bytes). A bit is a term which can have the value of zero or one.

question_html: For reproducing sound, a CD (Compact Disc) audio player uses a
explanation_html: Titanium needle. Interference is the reason for reproducing sound.

explanation_html: The Parliament referred to in the quotation is that of Kuwait.

2. Streamline body 

3. Multipoint fuel injection

Which of these features make the newer models of motor cars more fueld efficient ?

question_html: Which one of the following countries occupies the first place in the “Global Competitive Report” of World Economic Forum?
explanation_html: Singapore occupies the first place in the “Global Competitive Report” of World Economic Forum.

question_html: The best performance in terms of Human Development among the Asian countries is by
Which Article of the Constitution provides that it shall be the endeavour of every state to provide adequate facility for instruction in the mother tongue at the primary state of education?
explanation_html: • Article 350 A facilitates for instruction in mother-tongue at primary stage.

question_html: Which one of the following statements correctly describes the Fourth Schedule of the Constitution of India?
option_a: (a)  It lists the distribution of powers between the Union and the states.
option_b: (b)  It contains the languages listed in the Constitution
option_c: (c)  It contains the provisions regarding the administration of tribal areas
option_d: (d)  It allocates seats in the Council of States
explanation_html: • Fourth Schedule of the Constitution is about Allocation of Seats in the Council of States.

question_html:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

List I (Amendment to the Constitution)

List II (Contents)

A. The Constitution (sixty-ninth Amendment Act, 1991)

1. Establishment of state level Rent Amendment) Act, 1991

B. The Constitution (Seventy- Fifth Amendment Act, 1994)

2. No reservations for Scheduled Castes in Panchayats in Arunachal Pradesh

C. The Constitution (Eightieth Amendment) Act, 2000

3. Constitution of Panchayats in Villages or at other local levels

D. To Constitution (Eighty-third) Act, 2000

4. Accepting the recommendations of the Tenth Finance Commission

 

5. According the status of National Capital Territory to Delhi
explanation_html: • (a) 69th Amendment Act (1991) – To give the Status of N.C.T. (National Capital Territory) to Delhi. (b) 75th Amendment Act (1994) – For setting up of State-level Rent Tribunals. (c) 80th Amendment Act (2000) – Based on the recommendations of Tenth Finance Commission. (d) 83rd Amendment Act (2000) – No reservation for SCs in Arunachal Pradesh in Panchayats.

question_html: If a new state of the Indian Union is to be created, which one of the following schedules of the Constitution must be amended?
explanation_html: • The States and Union territories of India are specified in the First Schedule. So to form a new state and alteration of areas, boundaries or names of existing states requires the amendment of First Scheduled of the Constitution.

question_html: In what way does the Indian Parliament exercise control over the administration?
option_b: (b)  Through Consultative Committees of various ministries.
option_c: (c)  By making the administration send periodic reports.
option_d: (d)  By compelling the executive to issue writs.
explanation_html: • Parliament supervises the activities of the Executive with the help of its Committees like Committee on Government assurance, Committee on Subordinate legislation, Committee on Petition etc.

question_html: Which one of the following duties is NOT performed by the Comptroller and Auditor General of India?
option_a: (a)  To audit and report on all expenditure from the Consolidated Fund of India
option_b: (b)  To audit and report on all expenditure from the Contingency Funds and Public Accounts
option_c: (c)  To audit and report on all trading, manufacturing, profit and loss accounts
option_d: (d)  To control the receipt and issue of public money, and to ensure that the public revenue is lodged in the exchequer
explanation_html: • To audit and repot on all trading, manufacturing profit and loss accounts.

question_html:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

List I (Article of the Constitution)                II (Content) Constitution)

          A. Article 54                             1. Election of the President of India

          B. Article 75                             2. Appointment of the Prime Minister and Council of Ministers

          C. Article 155                           3. Appointment of the Governor of a state

          D. Article 164                          4. Appointment of the Chief Minister and Council of Ministers of a State.

                                                          5. Composition of Legislative Assemblies
explanation_html: • Article 54 – Election of the President. Article 75 – The Prime Minister shall be appointment by the President and the other ministers shall be appointed by the President on the advice of the Prime Minister. Article 155 – Appointment of a Governor. Article 164 – Appointment of Chief Minister and Council of Ministers of a State.

question_html:
Consider the following statements regarding the political parties in India:

1. The Representation of the People Act, 1951 provides for the registration of political parties.

2. Registration of political parties is carried out by the Election Commission.

3. A national level political party is one which is recognized in four or more states.

4. During the 1999 general elections, there were six national and 48 state level parties recognized by the Election Commission.

 Which of these statements are correct ?
explanation_html: • A national level political party should secure 6% of valid votes polled in any four or more states at a general election to the Loksabha or the Legislative assembly. (ii) in addition, it wins 4 seats in the Lok Sabha from any state. In 1999, there were 6 national parties and 48 states parties and 656 registered-unrecognized parties in India.

question_html:
Consider the following statements regarding the High Courts in India:

1. There are eighteen High Courts in the country.

2. Three of them have jurisdiction over more than one state.

3. No Union Territory has a High Court of its own.

4. Judges of the High Court hold office till the age of 62.

Which of these statements is/are correct ?
explanation_html: • There are 21 High Courts in the country, three having jurisdiction over more than one state. Among the Union Territories, Delhi alone has a High Court. Judges in the High Courts hold office up to 62 years of age.

question_html: The Supreme Court of India tenders advice to the President on a matter of law of fact
option_b: (b)  Only if he seeks such advice
option_c: (c)  Only if the matter relates to the Fundamental Rights of citizens
option_d: (d)  Only if the issue poses a threat to the unity and integrity of the country
explanation_html: Article 143 of the Constitution says that, if at any time it appears to the President that a question of law or fact has arisen, or is likely to arise, which is of such a nature and of such public importance that it is expedient to obtain the opinion of the Supreme Court up on it, he may refer the question to that court for consideration, and the court may, after such hearing as it thinks fit, report to the President its opinion thereon.

question_html:
Assertion (A): During the Neap Tides, the high tide is lower and the low tide is higher than usual.

Reason (R): The Neap Tide, unlike the Spring Tide, occurs on the New Moon instead of on the Full Moon.
option_a: (a) Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b) Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c) A is true but R is false
option_d: (d) A is false but R is true
explanation_html: The reason for lower high tide and higher low tide is – as it occurs on the new moon. So the gravitational pull of the new moon is less than the full moon.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Anticyclonic conditions are formed in winter season when atmospheric pressure is high and air temperatures are low.

Reason (R): Winter rainfall in Northern India causes development of anticyclonic conditions with low temperature.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Both A and R are correct but R is not the explanation of A.

question_html: The approximate age of the Aravallis range is
explanation_html: The Aravalli system is said to date back to 3,500 million years. Some later sediments seem to have been incorporated around 1,000 million years ago. So, in the given answers, maximum age is 670 million years.

question_html: Consider the decadal Census data given below: Decadal population (in millions) Year Population 1961 10.7 1971 14.3 1981 16.2 1991 18.9 The above data refer to which one of the ‘Population by Religion’ Groups:
explanation_html: The data mentioned here refers to the Christian population. The population of Christian was 10.7 million in 1961 (2.4%), 19.6 million in 1991 (2.34%).

question_html:
Consider the following statements about the minorities in India:

1. The Government of India has notified five communities, namely, Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Buddhists and Zoroastrians as Minorities.

2. The National Commission for Minorities was given statutory status in 1993.

3. The smallest religious minority in India are the Zoroastrians.

4. The Constitution of India recognizes and protects religious and linguistic minorities.

  Select the correct answer using the code given below.
explanation_html: All the statements are correct. Five religious communities, i.e., Muslims, Christians, Sikhs, Buddhists and Zoroastrians have been notified as minorities as per the provisions under the “National Commission for Minorities”, which was set up as a Statutory body in 1993. The smallest religious minority in India re the Zoroastrians concentrated in Maharashtra.

question_html: The largest number of Buddhists is found in
explanation_html: The largest number of Buddhists is found in Maharashtra. These are Neo-Buddhists who embraced this religion after large scale conversion under the influence of the movement launched by Baba Saheb Ambedkar.

question_html: The high density of population in Nile Valley and Island of Java is primarily due to
explanation_html: Fertile alluvial soil beds in these region lead to intensive agriculture, due to which the high density of population is seen in those areas.

question_html: Cloudly nights are warmer compared to clear cloudless nights, because clouds
option_a: (a)  Prevent cold waves from the sky from descending on earth
option_b: (b)  Reflect back the heart given off by earth
option_c: (c)  Produce heat and radiate it towards earth
option_d: (d)  Absorb heat from the atmosphere and send it towards earth

question_html:
Consider the following statements made about the sedimentary rocks:

  1. Sedimentary rocks are formed at earth"s surface by the hydrological system.
  2. The formation of sedimentary rocks involves the weathering of pre-existing rocks.
  3. Sedimentary rocks contain fossils.
  4. Sedimentary rocks typically occur in layers.

Select the correct answer using the code given below.
explanation_html: • All the statements are correct. The weathered material at the pre-existing rocks is transformed by the hydrolyzed systems and is deposited elsewhere in layers. They contain fossils.

question_html: Quartzite is metamorphosed from?
explanation_html: Quartzite is metamorphosed from Sandstone while Shale is from State.

question_html:
Consider the following statements regarding power sector in India:

1. The installed capacity of power generation is around 95000 MW.

2. Nuclear plants contribute nearly 15% of total power generation.

3. Hydroelectricity plants contribute nearly 40% of total power generation.

4. Thermal plants at present account for nearly 80% of total power generation.

Select the correct answer using the code given below.
explanation_html:
Power Generation in India:

1. Thermal – 80,902.45 MW

2. Hydro – 30,935.63 MW

3. Wind – 3,811.01 MW

4. Nuclear – 2,770.00 MW Total – 1,18,419.09 MW.

question_html: If the stars are seen to rise perpendicular to the horizon by an observer, he is located on the
Identify the correct order of the processes of soil-erosion from the following:
option_a: (a)  Splash erosion, Sheet erosion, Rill erosion, Gully erosion
option_b: (b)  Sheet erosion, Splash erosion, Gully erosion, Rill erosion
option_c: (c)  Rill erosion, Gully erosion, Sheet erosion, Splash erosion
option_d: (d)  Gully erosion, Rill erosion, Sheet erosion, Splash erosion
explanation_html: The correct order of soil erosion process is Splash-Sheet-Rill-Gully and Ravine erosion.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. Most magmas are a combination of liquid, solid and gas.

2. Water vapour and carbon dioxide are the principal gases dissolve in a magma.

3. Basaltic magma is hotter than the silicic magma.

4. The magma solidified between sedimentary rocks in a horizontal position is known as dike.

Which of these statements are correct ?
explanation_html: 1, 2, 3 statements are correct but not 4. Because, the magma solidified between sedimentary rocks in a horizontal position is known as “Sill”, but not Dyke (Dyke – solidification in vertical position).

question_html: Volcanic eruptions do not occur in the
explanation_html: Volcanic eruption do not occur in the Baltic Sea.

question_html: Which one of the following weather conditions is indicated by a sudden fall in barometer reading?
explanation_html: Stormy weather condition is indicated by a sudden fall in barometer reading. Because decrease of pressure indicates the advent of storms.

question_html:
Consider the following statements regarding environmental issues of India:

  1. Gulf of Mannar is one of the biosphere reserves.
  2. The Ganga Action Plan, phase II has been merged with the National River Conservation Plan.
  3. The National Museum of Natural History at New Delhi imparts non-formal education in environment and conservation.
  4. Environmental Information System (ENVIS) acts as a decentralized information network for environmental information.

Which of these statements are correct ?
explanation_html: • All the statements are correct. 'Gulf of Mannar' is one of the 14 biosphere reserves of India. Along with Nilgiri and Sunderbans, it was recognized on world Network of Biosphere Reserve by UNESCO.

question_html: The temperature and rainfall of a meteorological station are given below: Temperature (0C) Rainfall (cm) J 9.4 12.2 F 10.6 9.1 M 11.7 7.9 A 12.2 2.5 M 13.3 1.8 J 13.9 0.3 J 13.9 - A 14.4 - S 15.6 0.8 O 15.0 2.5 N 13.3 6.1 D 10.6 11.7 Average Temperature : 12.80C Average Rainfall : 54.9 cm per annum Identify the region having the above climatic pattern from amongst the following:
explanation_html: Concentration of rainfall in winter and dry, warm summers is the characteristic of Mediterranean or western margin climate.

question_html:
Consider the following statements regarding the earthquakes:

  1. The intensity of earthquake is measured on Mercalli Scale.
  2. The magnitude of an earthquake is a measure of energy released.
  3. Earthquake magnitudes are based on direct measurements of the amplitude of seismic waves.
  4. In the Richter Scale, each whole number demonstrate a hundredfold increase in the amount of energy released.

Which of these statements are correct?
explanation_html: • 1, 2, 3 statements are correct but not 4. Because in the Richter scale, each whole number demonstrates a ten fold increase in the amount of energy.

question_html: Who among the following presided over the Buddhist Council held during the reign of Kanishka at Kashmir?
explanation_html: 1st Council (Rajagriha) – Mahakassapa (Ajatashatru) 2nd Council (Vaisali) – Sabakami (Kalashoka) 3rd Council (Pataliputra) – Mogaliputta Tissa (Ashoka) 4th Council (Kashmir) – Vasumitra during the reign of Kanishka.

question_html: Which one of the following animals was NOT represented on the seals and terracotta art of the Harappan culture?
explanation_html: • Cow was not represented on the seals and terracotta art of the Harappan Culture.

question_html: Which one of the following pairs is correctly matched?
option_b: (b)  The Kushans : Gandhara School of Art
option_d: (d)  The Marathas : Pahari School of Painting
explanation_html:
Gandhara School of Art flourished during Kushan period.
 Harappan Civilization – Black on red pottery.
 Vedic Period – Painted Grey ware.
 Guptas – Ajanta paintings.
 Mughals – Pahari school of painting.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Harshavardhana convened the Prayag Assembly.

Reason (R): He wanted to popularise only the Mahayana form of Buddhism.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Harshavardhana convened the Prayag Assembly to popularize himself among his people. To popularize Mahayana of Buddhism at the instinct of Huen-Tsang, he called on a Conference at Kannauj.

question_html: Which one of Chola kings conquered Ceylon?
explanation_html: Rajaraja-I attacked and conquered Ceylon and later by Rajendra-I under whom the Ceylon was completely subjugated.

question_html: Hoysala monuments are found in
explanation_html: Hoysala monuments were found in Halebid and Belur. Hoysalas capital city was ‘Halebid’.

question_html:
Math List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

List I (Bhakti Saint)                                List II (Profession)

A. Namdev                                                1. Barber

B. Kabir.                                                     2. Weaver

D. Sena                                                      4. Cobbler
explanation_html:
Namdev – Tailor, Ravidas – Cobbler, Kabir – Weaver, Sena – Barber
 All of the above Bhakti saints were disciples of Swami Ramanand.

question_html:
Consider the following statements regarding Reserve Bank of India:

  1. It is a banker to the Central Government.
  2. It formulates and administers monetary policy.
  3. It acts as an agent of the Government in respect of India"s membership of IMF.
  4. It handles the borrowing programme of government of India.

Which of these statements are correct?
explanation_html:
Some of the functions of RBI are:

  • Banker to the Central Government.
  • Formulates and administers Monetary Policy.
  • Bank of issue.
  • Bankers to the bank.
  • Custodian of foreign exchange.
  • Controller of credit.
  • Banker, agent and financial adviser to the State.

question_html:
Consider the following schemes launched by the Union Government:

1. Antyodaya Anna Yojana

2. Gram Sadak Yojana

3. Sarvapriya

4. Jawahar Gram Samriddhi Yojana

Which of these were announced in the year 2000?
explanation_html: • Antyodaya Anna Yojana – 2000 Gram Sadak Yojana – 2000 Sarvapriya – 2001 Jawahar Gram Samriddhi Yojana – 1999.

question_html:
Consider the following factors regarding an industry:

  1. Capital investments
  2. Business turnover
  3. Labour force
  4. Power consumption

Which of these determine the nature and size of the industry?
explanation_html: • Capital investment, Labour force and Power consumption are the factors which denote the nature and size of the industry.

question_html: The most appropriate measure of a country"s economic growth is its
explanation_html: • The most appropriate measure of the country's economic growth is its "per capita Real income" which is also denoted as NNP at factor cost population.

question_html:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists: 

List I (Term)

List II (Explanation)

A. Fiscal deficit

1. Excess of total Expenditure over Total Receipts

B. Budget deficit

2. Excess of Revenue Expenditure over Revenue Receipts

C. Revenue deficit

3. Excess of Total Expenditure over Total Receipts less borrowings

D. Primary deficit

4. Excess of Total Expenditure over Total Receipts less borrowings and and Interest Payment.
explanation_html:
• A. Fiscal deficit - Excess of Total Expenditure over total Receipts less borrowings.
  • B. Budget deficit - Excess of Total Expenditure over Total Receipts.
  • C. Revenue deficit - Excess of Revenue Expenditure over Revenue Receipts.
  • D. Primary deficit - Excess of Total Expenditure over Total Receipts less borrowings Receipts less borrowings and Internet Payments.

question_html:
Consider the following organizations:

1. International Bank for Reconstruction and Development.

2. International Finance Corporation.

3. International Fund for Agricultural Development.

4. International Monetary Fund.

Which of these are agencies of the United Nations?
explanation_html: • All the above organizations i.e., IBRD, IFC, IFAD, and IMF are the agencies of UNO. IMF and World Bank/IBRD were established in 1945 with the result of Brettonwood’s agreement. IFC was established in 1956 as a subsidiary of the World Bank.

question_html: The Union Budget 2000 awarded a Tax Holiday for the North-Eastern Region to promote industrialization for:
explanation_html: • The Union Budget 2000 awarded a Tax holiday of 5 years for NE Region to promote Industrialization.

question_html:
Consider the following taxes:

  1. Corporation tax.
  2. Customs duty.
  3. Wealth tax.
  4. Excise duty

How many of these is/are indirect taxes?
explanation_html: 2 and 4 only

question_html: The largest share of Foreign Direct Investment (1997 – 2000) went to
explanation_html: • The largest share of Foreign Direct Investment (1997-2000) went to engineering sector.

question_html: The earlier name of WTO was:
explanation_html: • Uruguay Round talks of General Agreement on Trade and Tariffs (GATT) in 1994 led to the foundation for World Trade Organization (WTO) in 1995 with its head quarters at Geneva, Switzerland.

question_html: Which of the following committees examined and suggested Financial Sector reforms?
explanation_html: • Narasimhan Committee is related to Financial sector reforms (Banking Sector Reforms).

question_html: The new series of Wholesale Price Index (WPI) released by the Government of India is with reference to the base prices of.
explanation_html: • The new series of Wholesale Price Index (WPI) released by the Government of India is with reference to the base prices of 1993-94. Earlier, it was with 1981-82.

question_html: The term National Income represents:
option_a: (a)  Gross national product at market prices minus depreciation
option_b: (b)  Gross national product at market prices minus depreciation plus net factor income from abroad
option_c: (c)  Gross national product at market prices minus depreciation and indirect taxes plus subsidies
option_d: (d)  Gross national product at market prices minus net factor income from abroad
explanation_html: • National Income represents GNP at market prices minus depreciation and indirect taxes plus subsidies.

question_html:
Assertion (A): India’s software exports increased at an average growth rate of 50% since 1995-96.

Reason (R): Indian software companies were cost-effective and maintained international quality.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • India’s software exports increased at an average growth rate of 50% since 1995-96 which is due to cost effective nature of Indian Software Companies and maintenance of quality.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Ceiling on foreign exchange for a host of current account transaction heads was lowered in the year 2000.

option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.

explanation_html: Lingaraja temple located at Bhubaneshwar. It was dedicated to Shiva (Mukteshwara temple) built by ‘Chodaganga’.

question_html: The Mongols under Chengiz Khan invaded India during the reign of
explanation_html: The Mongols under Chengiz Khan invaded India during the reign of Iltutmish but did not enter deep in India as the Persian king was not given shelter by Iltutmish, whom Chengiz Khan was chasing.

question_html: Which among the following ports was called Babul Makka (Gate of Makka) during the Mughal Period?
explanation_html: Cambay was called Babul Makka (Gate of Makka) during the Mughal period because the pilgrimage to Makka was made from here.

explanation_html:
Dewan-i-Bandagani : by Feroz Tughlaq (Department of Slaves)
 Dewan-i-Alauddin Khalji
 Dewan-i-Kohi : Muhammad Bin Tughlaq
 Dewan-i-Arz : Balban

question_html:
Assertion (A): The Battle of Khanna was certainly more decisive and significant that the first Battle of Panipat.

Reason (R): Rana Sanga, the Rajput hero, was certainly a more formidable adversary than Ibrahim Lodi.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Rana Sanga was more formidable adversely than Ibrahim Lodi as he had once defeated Ibrahim Lodi. So battle of Khanna was certainly more significant and decisive than first battle of Panipat.

question_html: Who among the following Indian rulers established embassies in foreign countries on modern lines?
explanation_html: Tipu Sultan established embassies in foreign countries like Egypt, France and Turkey on modern lines.

question_html: The Hunter Commission was appointed after the
explanation_html: To investigate into the events of Jallianwalabagh tragedy, occurred in April 13, 1919, the Hunter Commission was appointed.

question_html: Under the Permanent Settlement, 1793, the Zamindars were required to issue pattas to the farmers which were not issued by many of the Zamindars. The reason was
option_a: (a)  The Zamindars were trusted by the farmers
option_b: (b)  There was no official check upon the zamindars
option_c: (c)  It was the responsibility of the British government
option_d: (d)  The farmers were not interested in getting pattas
explanation_html: There was no official check upon the Zamindars under the permanent settlement, 1793. They were required to give 10/11th of revenue collections to the British authorities.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. Arya Samaj was founded in 1835.

2. Lala Lajpat Rai opposed the appeal of Arya Samaj to the authority of Vedas in support of its social reform programmes.

3. Under Keshab Chandra Sen, the Brahmo Samaj campaigned for women’s education.

4. Vinoba Bhave founded the Sarvodaya Samaj to work among refugees.

Which of these statements are correct?
explanation_html: Arya Samaj was founded in the year 1875 by Swami Dayananda Saraswathi. Lala Lajpat Rai was one of the members of Arya Samaj and supported the appeal of Arya Samaj to the authority of Vedas in support of the social reform programmes.

question_html: Who among the following leaders proposed to adopt Complete Independence as the goal of the Congress in the Ahmedabad session of 1920?
explanation_html: Hasrat Mohani proposed to adopt complete independence as the goal of the Congress in the Ahmedabad session of 1920. It was opposed by Gandhiji which led to the rejection of resolution for complete independence.

question_html: Who among the following organized the famous Chittagong armoury raid?
explanation_html: Surya Sen led the famous Chittagong Armoury raid on 18th April 1930.

question_html: A London branch of the All India Muslim League was established in 1908 under the presidency of
explanation_html: Aga Khan was the President of Muslim League in India. Liaquat Ali and Jinnah were in Congress at that time. Ameer Ali, a judge from Calcutta High Court (1890-1904), later settled in England and founded Muslim League there.

question_html: Who amongst the following Englishmen, first translated Bhagvad-Gita into English?
explanation_html: Charles Wilkins was the first Englishmen to translate Bhagavad Gita into English. He was a member of Asiatic Society founded by William Jones.

question_html: Who among the following, was the President of the All-India States People’s Conference in 1939?
explanation_html: Jawaharlal Nehru was the President of the All-India States People’s Conference in 1939 which aims at securing peoples sovereignty in the princely states.

question_html: Which of the following pairs is NOT correctly matched?
option_a: (a)  India’s first technicolour film : Jhansi Ki Rani
option_d: (d)  India’s first actress to win the Bharat Ratna : Meena Kumari
explanation_html: No actress was awarded Bharat Ratna. Satyajit Ray (Director) and Lata Mangeshkar (Singer) were awarded Bharat Ratna in 1992 and 2001 respectively.

question_html: The prices at which the government purchases food grains for maintaining the public distribution for maintaining the public distribution system and for building up buffer – stocks is known as
explanation_html: Government purchases food grains for maintaining public distribution system and for building up buffer stock at ‘procurement prices’.

question_html: National Agriculture Insurance Scheme replacing Comprehensive Crop Insurance Scheme was introduced in the year
explanation_html: National Agricultural Insurance Scheme replacing Comprehensive Crop Insurance Scheme was introduced in the year 1999. The main objective of the scheme is to protect the farmers against crop losses suffered on account of natural calamities such as droughts, flood, hailstorm, cyclone, fire, pests and diseases.

question_html:
Consider the following states:

1. Gujarat.

2. Karnataka.

3. Maharashtra

4. Tamil Nadu

The descending order of these states with reference to their level of Per Capita Net State Domestic Product is
explanation_html: The descending order of the states with reference to their level to per capita Net Domestic Product is Maharashtra, Gujarat, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu.

question_html:
Consider the following:

1. Market borrowing

2. Treasury bills

3. Special securities issued to RBI

Which of these is/are component(s) of internal debt?
explanation_html: Internal debt comprises to Market borrowing, Treasury bills and Special Securities issue to RBI.

question_html: When lightwaves pass from air to glass, the variables affected are
explanation_html: Light travels at different velocities in different media i.e. velocity decreases when it passes from rarer (air) to denser medium (glass). Refraction (bending of light) takes place when light passes from one medium to other medium while more a ray bent in passing through different media the shorter will be wavelength. Frequency of medium does not change with medium (Velocity = Frequency x Wavelength).

question_html: When water is heated from 0 degree C to 10 degree C its volume
explanation_html: The mass of a body does not change from place to place (with respect to gravity). It is weight (W = mg) of a body which changes from one place to another as its value depends on acceleration due to gravity (g) which changes from one place to another.

question_html: Who amongst the following was the first to state that the earth was spherical?
explanation_html: Aristotle was the first to state that the earth was spherical.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

 A simple pendulum is set into oscillation.

1.Then the acceleration is zero when the bob passes through the mean position.

2. In each cycle the bob attains a given velocity twice.

3. Both acceleration and velocity of the bob are zero when it reaches its extreme position during its oscillation.

4. The amplitude of oscillation of the simple pendulum decreases with time.

Which of these statements are correct?
explanation_html: At the extreme position the acceleration of the bob will be maximum and the velocity will be ‘zero’ during the oscillation and vice versa at the mean position of an oscillation.

question_html:
Assertion (A): A stick is dipped in water in a slanting position. If observed sideways, the stick appears short and bent at the surface of water.

Reason (R): The light coming from the stick undergoes scattering from water molecules giving the stick a short and bent appearance.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: The stick appears short and bent at the surface of water because of Refraction of the light and not scattering.

question_html:
Assertion (A): A piece of copper and a piece of glass are heated to the same temperature. When touched, thereafter, the copper piece appears hotter than the glass piece.

Reason (R): The density of copper is more than that of glass.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Copper has now specific heat capacity and high thermal conductivity compared to the glass. Hence copper piece appears hotter than the glass piece not because of density.

question_html:
Assertion (A): The boiling point of water decreases as the altitude increases.

Reason (R): The atmospheric pressure increases with altitude.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: The atmospheric decreases with increases in altitude while the boiling point decreases with decrease in pressure and increase in altitude.

explanation_html: Zirconium is not radioactive element while Astatine, Francium and Tritium are radioactive and release and  rays in their emissions.
