explanation_html: • Directive Principles of State Policy from Ireland Fundamental Rights from United States Concurrent List from Australia Federation with a Strong Centre, vesting of residuary powers in the Centre, from Canada.

question_html: The Ninth Schedule to the Indian Constitution was added by
explanation_html: • First amendment made in 1951, inserted two new articles, 31A and 31B and the Ninth Schedule to give protection from challenge to land reforms.

question_html: Which of the following Constitutional Amendments are related to raising the number of Members of Lok Sabha to be elected from the States?
explanation_html: • 74th Constitutional Amendment Act (1956) provides for composition of the House of the people, re-adjustment after every census. 31st Amendment Act (1973) increased the number of Lok Sabha seats from 525 to 545.

question_html: Which one of the following Articles of the Indian Constitution provides that ‘It shall be the duty of the Union to protect every State against external aggression and internal disturbance’?
explanation_html: • Article 215 – High Courts to be Courts of record Article 275 – Grants from the Union to certain States Article 325 – No person to be ineligible for inclusion, in or to claim to be included in a special, electoral roll on grounds of religion, race, caste and sex.

question_html: Which one of the following schedules of the Indian Constitution lists the names of states and specifies their territories?
explanation_html: • First Schedule of Indian Constitution lists the names of States and specifies their territories.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. While members of the Rajya Sabha are associated with Committees on Public Accounts and Public Undertakings, members of Committee on Estimates are drawn entirely from Lok Sabha.

2. The Ministry of Parliamentary Affairs works under the overall direction of Cabinet Committee on Parliamentary Affairs.

3. The Minister of Parliamentary Affairs nominates Members of Parliament on Committees, Councils, Board and Commissions etc. set up by the Government of India in the various ministries.

Which of these statements are correct?
explanation_html: • All of the above statements are correct.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. The joint sitting of the two houses of the Parliament in India is sanctioned under Article 108 of the Constitution.

2. The first joint sitting of Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha was held in the year 1961.

3. The second joint sitting of the two Houses of Indian Parliament was held to pass the Banking Service Commission (Repeal) Bill.

Which of these statements is correct?
explanation_html:
All the options given in the Question are correct.

1. Article 108 – Joint sitting of both Houses in certain cases.

2. The First Joint sitting was held on 6 May, 1961, in which Dowry Prohibition Bill, 1960 was passed.

3. The Second Joint sitting was held to pass the Banking Service Commission (Repeal) Bill, 1977, on 16 May, 1978.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is correct?
option_a: (a)  Only the Rajya Sabha and not the Lok Sabha can have nominated members
option_b: (b)  There is a constitutional provision for nominating two members belonging to the Anglo-Indian community to the Rajya Sabha
option_c: (c)  There is no constitutional bar for a nominated member to be appointed as a Union minister
option_d: (d)  A nominated member can vote both in the Presidential and Vice Presidential elections
explanation_html: • (a) Rajya Sabha has 12 and Lok Sabha has 2 (from Anglo-Indian Community) nominated members. (b) The Constitutional provision for nominating 2 members belonging to the Anglo-Indian Community is to Lok Sabha (But not Rajya Sabha). (c) A nominated member can vote only in the election of the Vice-President.

question_html: The power to enlarge the jurisdiction of the Supreme Court of India with respect to any matter included in the Union List of Legislative Powers rests with
option_d: (d)  The Union Ministry of Law, Justice and Company Affairs
explanation_html: • The Parliament can regulate the organization and jurisdiction of the Supreme Court. It can extend the jurisdiction but cannot curtain the same.

question_html: Which one of the following Bills must be passed by each House of the Indian Parliament separately, by special majority?
explanation_html: • Article 368 – A Constitutional Amendment Bill must be passed by each House separately with a special majority i.e. not less than two-third of the members of the House present and voting.

question_html: Under which Article of the Indian Constitution did the President give his assent to the ordinance on electoral reforms when it was sent back to him by the Union Cabinet without making any changes (in the year 2002)?
explanation_html: • Under Article 123 of the Indian Constitution, President has the power to promulgate ordinance while for the Governor of a State can do the same under Article 213. Article 111 – The President may return the Bill (if it is not a Money Bill) to the Houses to reconsider, and when a Bill is so returned the Houses shall reconsider the Bill accordingly, and if the Bill is passed again by the Houses with or without amendment and presented to the President for assent, the President shall not withhold assent there from.

question_html: Under which Article of the Indian Constitution did the President make a reference to the Supreme Court to seek the Court’s opinion on the Constitutional validity of the Election Commission’s decision on deferring the Gujarat Assembly elections (in the year 2002)?
explanation_html: • Article 143 – The Power of President to consult Supreme Court.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

In the electoral college for Presidential Election in India,

1. The value of the vote of an elected Member of Legislative Assemble equals

                                 State Population

              Number of Elected MLAs of the State x 100.

2. The value of the vote of an elected Member of Parliament equals

                   Total Value of the votes of all elected MLAs

                              Total Number of elected MPs.

3. There were more than 5000 members in the latest elections.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: • Value of an elected MLA = State Population / No. of elected MLA’s of the State x 1000.

question_html: As per Indian Protocol, who among the following ranks highest in the order of precedence?
option_c: (c)  Governor of a State within his State
explanation_html: • The order of Precedence for the given optional is Governor of a State within his state > Former Presidents. Deputy Prime Minister > Lok Sabha Speaker.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

The function(s) of the Finance Commission is/are:

  1. To allow the withdrawal of the money out of the Consolidated Fund of India.
  2. To allocate between the States the shares of proceeds of taxes.
  3. To consider applications for grants-in-aid from States.
  4. To supervise and report on whether the Union and State governments are levying taxes in accordance with the budgetary provisions.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html:
Functions of Finance Commission are to recommend:

  • The distribution of the net proceeds of taxes to be shared between the Centre and the State.
  • The principles that should govern the grants-in-aid to the States by the Centre.
  • Measures needed to augment the Consolidated Fund of a State.

question_html: Which one of the following High Courts has the Territorial Jurisdiction over Andaman and Nicobar Islands?
explanation_html: • The Calcutta High Court has the territorial jurisdiction over West Bengal, it is having Circuit Bench at Port Blair.

question_html:
Assertion (A): The amount of moisture in the atmosphere is related to latitude.

Reason (R): The capacity to hold moisture in the form of water vapor is related to temperature.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: The amount of moisture in the atmosphere is related to latitude. Because, according to the change in latitudes, temperature also varies on the earth. Temperature directly influences the moisture holding capacity of the atmosphere.

question_html: What is the correct sequence of the rivers-Godavari, Mahanadi, Narmada and Tapi in the descending order of their lengths?
explanation_html: Godavari with 1465 km, length, Mahanadi with 828 km length, are flowing from west to east. Narmada with 1312 km length, Tapi with 724 km length are flowing from east to west. So, the descending order of their lengths is Godavari > Narmada > Mahanadi > Tapi.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Coal-based thermal power stations contribute to acid-rain.

Reason (R): Oxides of carbon are emitted when coal burns.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Coal based thermal power stations emit the oxides of Carbon (like CO, CO2 etc.) Sulphur (SO2), Nitrogen (NO2, N2O) etc. with the combustion of coal. When coal burns. After reacting with the atmospheric moisture these oxides produce acids and contribute to acid rains. So, both statements are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. In Macedonia, ethnic Albanians are a minority.

2. In Kosovo, Serbians are a majority.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: Both are correct. In Macedonia, ethnic Albanians are a minority. In Kosovo, Serbians are a majority.

question_html: Israel has common borders with
explanation_html: Israel has common borders with Lebanon and Syria in the north and north-east, Jordan in the east, and Egypt in the west.

question_html: Which one of the following countries is land locked?
explanation_html: Bolivia is land locked among Brazil, Peru, Chile, Argentina and Paraguay.

question_html: Which amongst the following States has the highest population density as per Census-2001?
explanation_html: Density of population is expressed as man-land ratio, i.e., number of persons per unit of geographical area. The state wise population density varies from 13 persons in Arunachal Pradesh to 904 persons in West Bengal.

question_html: Which one among the following States is smallest in area?
explanation_html: Tamil Nadu is the smallest in area, in the given optionals. The decreasing order of the area is Andhra Pradesh > Gujarat > Karnataka > Tamil Nadu.

question_html: Which one among the following States has the highest female literacy rate as per the Census 2001?
explanation_html: The female literacy rates of Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh, Orissa and Rajasthan are 51.85%, 50.29%, 50-51% and 43.85% respectively, according to 2001 Census.

question_html: Life expectancy is highest in the world in:
explanation_html: Highest life expectancy in the world is in Japan (80.9 years) next to it, Canada (79.9 years), Norway (78.9 years) and Germany (77.8 years).

question_html: Which among the following countries has the largest population?
explanation_html: In the given countries, Indonesia has the largest population (23,20,73,071) next to in Pakistan (14,76,00,000), Japan (12,70,00,000), Sudan (3,71,00,000).

question_html: Which one among the following has the largest shipyard in India?
explanation_html: Kochi (Cochin) Shipyard Limited is designed to construct ships of size upto 1,10,000 DWT and repair ships up to 1,25,000 DWT. It is the only shipyard with ISO-9001 accreditation for ship building, ship-repair and marine engineering training in India.

question_html:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

List I (Organization)

List II (Location)

A. National Sugar Institute

1. Dehradun

B. Mishra Dhatu Nigam Ltd.

2. Kamptee

C. Institute of Military Law

3. Pune

D. Institute of National Integration

4. Hyderabad

 

5. Kanpur

     A B C D
explanation_html: A. National Sugar Institute – Kanpur B. Mishra Dhatu Nigam Ltd. – Hyderabad C. Institute of Military Law – Kamptee D. Institute of National Integration – Pune.

question_html: Among the following which planet takes maximum time for one revolution around the Sun?
explanation_html: Jupiter takes 12 years for one revolution where as earth takes 1 year, Mars takes 687 days and Venus takes 263 days.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Areas lying within five to eight degrees latitude on either side of the equator receive rainfall throughout the year.

Reason (R): High temperatures and high humidity cause convectional rain to fall mostly in the afternoons near the equator.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Areas lying within 50–80 latitude on either side of the equator receives convectional rainfall, mostly in the afternoons throughout the year, due to high humidity and high temperatures.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_a: (a)  India is the second largest producer for nitrogenous fertilizers in the world
option_b: (b)  India is the ninth largest steel producing country in the world
option_c: (c)  India is the second largest producer of silk in the world
option_d: (d)  India ranks third in the world in coal production
explanation_html: India is the Eighth largest steel producing country in the world. India is the third largest producer of nitrogenous fertilizers in the world after U.S.A. and China. (Remaining two statements are correct).

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. India is the original home of the cotton plant.

2. India is the first country in the world to develop hybrid cotton variety leading to increased production.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: Both statements are correct. Among the four cultivated cotton species, Gossypium arboreum is supposed to be native of India. India is the first country in the world to develop hybrid cotton named H-4 in Gujarat Agricultural University.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. India ranks first in the world in fruit production.

2. India ranks second in the world in the export of tobacco.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: India ranks second in the world in fruit production after China.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. Longitude of Jabalpur’s location is between those of Indore and Bhopal.

2. Latitude of Aurangabad’s location is between those of Vadodara and Pune.

3. Bangalore is situated more southward than Chennai.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: Statements 2, 3 are correct. Longitude of Jabalpur’s location is eastwards of those of Indore and Bhopal; but not in between them.

question_html: Among the following cities, which one is nearest to the Tropic of Cancer?
explanation_html: Kolkata is the nearest city to the Tropic of Cancer (23½° North latitude). Kolkata is located just below the Tropic of Cancer.

question_html: Nanda Devi peak forms a part of
explanation_html: Nanda devi peak (7817 mts) forms part of Kumaon Himalayas which extends from the river Sutlej to the Kali to a distance of 320 km.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Unlike temperate forests, the tropical rain forests, if cleared, can yield productive farmland that can support intensive agriculture for several years even without chemical fertilizers.

Reason (R): The primary productivity of the tropical rain forest is very high when compared to that of temperate forests.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: A is wrong R is correct. In tropical rainforests because of the rainfall throughout the year, leaching of minerals occur. Due to high temperatures bacterial activity is enormous, there by humous cantent in the soil decreases. To raise crops in this region requires application of chemical fertilizers.

question_html: Which one among the following covers the highest percentage of forest area in the world?
explanation_html: • Temperate coniferous forests cover the highest percentage of forest area in the world.

question_html: Which one of the following counties does Not border the Caspian Sea?
explanation_html: Armenia is land locked among Georgia, Azerbaijan, Iran and Turkey.

question_html:
Assertion (A): The eastern coast of India produces more rice than the western coast.

Reason (R): The eastern coast receives more rainfall than the western coast.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Statement A is correct. West Bengal, Orissa, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Assam states are producing more than 75% of the Rice in river delta regions. Statement R is wrong. Because the 1000 mm isohyet runs southwards from the Gujarat coast, roughly parallel to the crest of Western Ghats upto Kanyakumari. The rainfall over the peninsular regions lying to the east of this line drops abruptly to below 600 mm, as it lies in the rain-shadow region. So, west coast receives more rainfall than east coast.

question_html: The thermal power plant of Bokaro is located in
explanation_html: Bokaro is situated at a point between Jamshedpur and Jharia coal fields and near to Raniganj Coal fields in Jharkhand. Its establishment integrates the entire steel-coal belt into one closely Knit industrial region.

question_html: Emperor Harsha’s southward march was stopped on the Narmada river by
explanation_html: Emperor Harsha’s southward march was stopped on the Narmada river by Chalukya King of Vatapi-Pulakesin-II.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

  1. The Cholas defeated Pandya and Chera rulers and established their domination over peninsular India in the early medieval times.
  2. The Cholas sent an expedition against Sailendra empire of South East India and conquered some of the areas.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: • Chola's established their domination in peninsular India by defeating Pandya and Chera rulers. Naval expedition by Rajendra-I of Chola's against Sailendra empire of South East Asia as Srivijaya rulers created difficulties of Indian merchants.

question_html: ‘Mrichchhakatika’ an ancient Indian book written by Shudraka deals with
option_a: (a)  The love affair of a rich merchant with the daughter of a courtesan
option_b: (b)  The victory of Chandragupta II over the Shaka Kshatrapas of western India
option_c: (c)  The military expeditions and exploits of Samudragupta
option_d: (d)  The love affair between a Gupta King and a princess of Kamarupa
explanation_html: ‘Mrichhakatikam’ of Sudraka deals with the love affair of a rich merchant called ‘Charudatta’ and the daughter of a courtesan called ‘Vasanthasena’. ‘Mrichchhakatika’ is also known as ‘Little clay cart’.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. Vardhaman Mahavira’s mother was the daughter of Lichchhavi chief Chetaka.

2. Gautama Buddha’s mother was a princess from the Koshalan dynasty.

3. Parshvanatha, the twenty-third Tirthankara, belonged to Banaras.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html:
Trisala, the mother of Vardhaman Mahavira, was the sister of Lichchhavi Chief Chetaka.
 1st Tirthankara : Rishabhnath
 23rd Tirthankara : Parshvanath
 24th and last Tirthankara : Vardhamana Mahavira

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

  1. The last Mauryan ruler, Brihadratha was assassinated by his commander-in-chief, Pushyamitra Sunga.
  2. The last Sunga king, Devabhuti was assassinated by his Brahmana minister Vasudeva Kanva who usurped the throne.
  3. The last ruler of the Kanva dynasty was deposed by the Andhras.

Which of the statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: • Pushyamitra Sunga killed Brihadratha to establish 'Sunga' dynasty. Vasudeva Kanva established 'Kanva' dynasty by killing the last Sunga ruler, Devabhuti. The last ruler of Kanva dynasty 'Susharma' was killed by 'Andhra Simuk' to establish 'Satavahana dynasty'.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Saluva Narasimha put an end to the old dynasty and assumed the royal title.

Reason (R): He wanted to save the kingdom from further degeneration and disintegration.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • Saluva Narasimha ended the Sangama dynasty and seized the throne for himself and started the Saluva dynasty. He assumed the royal title due to his greed for power.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

In India. stamp duties on financial transactions are

  1. levied and collected by the State Government.
  2. appropriated by the Union Government.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: • Stamp duties on bills of exchanges, cheques, promissory notes, and others (Financial transactions) are levied by the Centre but collected and appropriated by the States.

question_html:
Consider the following statements

1. The maximum limit of shareholding of Indian promoters in private sector banks in India is 49 per cent of the paid up capital.

2. Foreign Direct Investment upto 49 per cent from all sources is permitted in private sector banks in India ruler the automatic route.

Which of these statements is/are correct ?
explanation_html: • FDI upto 49% is allowed in private sector banks through automatic route.

question_html:
Assertion (A): During the year 2001-02, the value of India’s total exports declined, registering a negative growth of 2.17%.

Reason (R): During the year 2001-02, negative growth in exports was witnessed in respect of iron and steel, coffee, textiles and marine products.
option_a: (a) Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b) Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c) A is true but R is false
option_d: (d) A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • Assertion is false because in 2001-02, the total exports registered a negative growth of 1.6%.

question_html:
Assertion (A): The new EXIM policy is liberal, market-oriented and favours global trade.

Reason (R): GATT has played a significant role in the liberalization of the economy.
option_a:
(a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct
explanation of A
option_b:
(b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the
correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • Both A and R are individually true, but R does not explain A. The reason for liberal EXIM policy is the economic liberalization started in 1991.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. In the last five years, Indian software exports have increased at a compound annual growth rate of about 60%.

2. The software and service industry in India registered an overall growth of about 28% in rupee terms during the year 2001-2002.

Which of these statements is/are correct ?
explanation_html: • Software exports were increased from Rs. 6350 crore in 1997-98, to Rs. 48,000 crore in 2001-02. Thus, software exports increased at a Compound annual growth rate of 60% in the last five years. The Software and Service Industry registered 28% growth in rupee terms during 2001-02.

question_html:
With reference to Government of India’s decisions regarding Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) during the year 2001-02, consider the following statements:

1. Out of the 100% FDI allowed by India in tea sector, the foreign firm would have to disinvest 33% of the equity in favour of an Indian partner within four years.

2. Regarding the FDI in print media in India, the single largest Indian shareholders should have a holding higher than 26%.

Which of these statements is/are correct ?
explanation_html: • FDI was allowed upto 26% is the print media in India. In tea sector, the foreign firm would have to disinvest 26% of the equity in favour of an Indian partner within 5 years.

question_html: In India, the first bank of limited liability managed by Indians and founded in 1881 was
explanation_html: • In India, Oudh Commercial Bank founded in 1881 was the first bank of limited liability managed by Indians.

question_html: The Government holding in BPCL is
explanation_html: • Government holding in BPCL is between 60% and 70%.

question_html: During the year 2000-01, which one of the following industries recorded highest growth rate in India?
explanation_html: • During 2000-01, Steel industry recorded highest growth rate.

question_html: Debenture holders of a company are its
explanation_html: • Debenture holders of a company are its creditors as they were paid a fixed rate of interest by the company. Debenture are the securities issued by limited companies Debenture are the securities issued when the share capital of the company falls short of its requirements.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is correct with reference to FEMA in India?
option_a: (a) The Foreign Exchange Regulating Act (FERA) was replaced by Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) in the year 2001
option_b: (b) FERA was given a sunset clause of one year till 31st May, 2002 to enable Enforcement Directorate to complete the investigation of pending issues
option_c: (c) Under FEMA, violation of foreign exchange rules has ceased to be a criminal offence
option_d: (d) As per the new dispensation, Enforcement Directorate can arrest and prosecute the people for the violation of foreign exchange rules
explanation_html: • The Foreign Exchange Regulating Act, 1773 was replaced by Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 which has come into force from June 1, 2000. Under FERA, any offence was a criminal offence liable to imprisonment whereas FEMA seeks to make offences relating to foreign exchange and civil offences.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. India’s import of crude and petroleum products during the year 2001-02 accounted for about 27% of India’s total imports.

2. During the year 2001-02, India’s exports had increased by 10% as compared to the previous year.

  Which of these statements is/are correct ?
explanation_html: • During the year 2001-02, India’s exports increased by 3.7 percent by volume compared to the previous year.

question_html: Among the following cities, which one is at the highest altitude above mean sea level?
explanation_html: Bangalore is located on the Bangalore plateau, whereas remaining cities (Jodhpur, Nagpur, Delhi) are located on the plains. So, Bangalore is at the highest altitude above man sea level.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Emperor Akbar marched towards Afghanistan in 1581 with a huge army.

Reason (R): He was on his way to reclaim his ancestral country of Ferghana in Central Asia.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • Akbar marched towards Afghanistan in 1581 to create a safety valve to his empire, but not to reclaim his ancestral country of Ferghana in Central Asia.

question_html: Alam Khan, one of those who invited Babur to invade India was?
option_a: (a)  An uncle of Ibrahim Lodi and a pretender to the throne of Delhi
option_b: (b)  A cousin of Ibrahim Lodi who was ill-treated and expelled from the country
option_c: (c)  The father of Dilawar Khan to whom cruel treatment was meted out by Ibrahim Lodi
option_d: (d)  A high official in Punjab province who was very much discontented with Ibrahim Lodi’s treatment to his tribe
explanation_html: • Alam Khan was an uncle of Ibrahim Lodi and a pretender to the throne of Delhi.

question_html: The battle of Dharmat was fought between?
option_d: (d)  Ahmad Shah Durrani and the Marathas
explanation_html: • Dara Shikoh was a brother of Aurangzeb and both fought against each other for Delhi’s throne with the support of Raja Jaswant Singh and Prince Murad respectively.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. Kitab-i-Nauras, a collection of songs in praise of Hindu deities and Muslim saints, was written by Ibrahim Adil Shah II.

2. Amir Khusrau was the originator in India of the early form of the musical style known as Qawali.

Which of these statements is/are correct ?
explanation_html: • Ibrahim Adil Shah II wrote Kitab-i-Nauras. Amir Khusrau was the originator in India of the early form of musical style known as Qawali.

question_html: How did Sultan Qutb-ud-din Aibak die?
option_a: (a)  He was treacherously stabbed to death by one of his ambitious nobles
option_b: (b)  He was killed in a battle with Taj-u-din Yildiz, the ruler of Ghazni who entered into a contest with him over the capture of Punjab
option_c: (c)  He sustained injuries while besieging the fortress of Kalijar in Bundelkhand and succumbed to them later
option_d: (d)  He died after a fall from his horse while playing Chaugan
explanation_html: • Qutubuddin Aibak died after a fall from his horse while playing ‘Chaugan’.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Marathas emerged as the strongest native power in India after the decline of Mughal empire.

Reason (R): Marathas were the first to have a clear concept of a united Indian nation.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • Marathas rose on the spoils of Mughal decline. Aurangzeb’s religious policy coupled with growth of Maharashtradharma grew as a power enough to dominate the political scene. But their feudal division was not a true approach to United India concept.

question_html: How did the Mughal Emperor Jahandarshah’s reign come to an early end?
option_a: (a)  He was deposed by his Wazir
option_b: (b)  He died due to a slip while climbing down steps
option_c: (c)  He was defeated by his nephew in a battle
option_d: (d)  He died of sickness due to too much consumption of wine.
explanation_html: • Jahandar Shah was defeated and killed by his nephew Furrukhsiyar with the help of Sayyid brothers.

question_html: The leader of the Bardoli Satyagraha (1928) was
explanation_html: • Bardoli Satyagraha by the Kunbi-patidar and owning peasants and untouchables, supported by Vallabhbhai Patel, Mehta brothers (1928, Surat, Gujarat) against oppression by upper castes and hike in revenue by 22 percent by the Bombay Government. The title ‘Sardar’ was given by Bardoli women to Vallabhbhai Patel.

question_html: During the colonial period in India, what was the purpose of the Witley Commission?
option_a: (a)  To review the fitness of India for further political reforms
option_b: (b)  To report on existing conditions of labour and to make recommendations
option_c: (c)  To draw up a plan for financial reforms for India
option_d: (d)  To develop a comprehensive scheme for Civil Services in India
explanation_html: • To report on existing conditions of labour and to make recommendations.

question_html:
Assertion (A): In 1916, Maulana Mohammad Ali and Abul Kalam Azad resigned from the Legislative Council.

Reason (R): The Rowlatt Act was passed by the Government in spite of being opposed by all Indian members of the Legislative Council.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • During World War-I, Mohammad Ali was interned and Azad’s publication Al hilal was suppressed. They were not members of the Legislative Council.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Shah Alam II spent the initial years as an Emperor far away from his capital.

 Reason (R): There was always a lurking danger of foreign invasion from the north-west frontier.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • Shah Alam II spent the initial years as an Emperor away from his capital because of the fear of his wazir.

question_html: With reference to the entry of European powers into India, which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_b: (b)  The English opened their first factory in South India at Masulipatnam
option_c: (c)  In Eastern India, the English Company opened its first factory in Orissa in 1633
option_d: (d)  Under the leadership of Dupleix, the French occupied Madras in 1746
explanation_html: • The Portuguese captured Goa in 1510.

question_html: With reference to Indian freedom struggle, which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_a: (a)  The Rowlatt Act aroused a wave of popular indignation and led to the Jallianwala Bagh massacre.
option_b: (b)  Subhash Chandra Bose formed the Forward Bloc
option_c: (c)  Bhagat Singh was one of the founders of Hindustan Republican Socialist Association
option_d: (d)  In 1931, the Congress Session at Karachi opposed Gandhi-Irwin Pact
explanation_html: • Gandhi prevailed upon Karachi Session to approve this agreement of 1931.

question_html: In India, among the following locations, the Dutch established their earliest factory at
explanation_html: • The Dutch established their earliest factory at Pulicat.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_a: (a)  The National Song Vande Mataram was composed by Bankimchandra Chatterji originally in Bengali
option_b: (b)  The National Calendar of India based on Saka era has its 1st Chaitra on 22nd March normally and 21st March in a leap year
option_c: (c)  The design of the National Flag of India was adopted by the Constituent Assembly on 22nd July, 1947
option_d: (d)  The song ‘Jana-gana-mana’, composed originally in Bengali by Rabindranath Tagore was adopted in its Hindi version by the Constituent Assembly on 24th January, 1950 as the National Anthem of India
explanation_html: • The National Song Vande Matram was composed by Bankim Chandra Chatterji originally in Sanskrit.

question_html: The aim of education as stated by the Wood’s dispatch of 1854 was
option_a: (a)  The creation of employment opportunities for native Indians
option_b: (b)  The spread of western culture in India
option_c: (c)  The promotion of literacy among the people using English medium of language
option_d: (d)  The introduction of scientific research and rationalism in the traditional Indian education
explanation_html: • Wood’s dispatch of 1854 stated that the aim of education is the promotion of literacy among the people using English as medium of language.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_a: (a)  Ali Mardan Khan introduced the system of revenue farming in Bengal
option_b: (b) Maharaja Ranjit Singh set up modern foundries to manufacture cannons at Lahore
option_c: (c)  Sawai Jai Singh of Amber had Euclid’s ‘Elements of Geometry’ translated into Sanskrit
option_d: (d)  Sultan Tipu of Mysore gave money for the construction of the idol of Goddess Sarda in the Shringeri temple
explanation_html: • Murshid Quli Khan introduced the system of revenue farming in Bengal.

question_html: Which one of the following provisions was NOT made in the Charter Act of 1833?
option_a: (a)  The trading activities of the East India Company were to be abolished
option_b: (b)  The designation of the supreme authority was to be changed as the Governor-General of India in Council
option_c: (c)  All law-making powers to be conferred on Governor-General in Council
option_d: (d)  An Indian was to be appointed as a Law Member in Governor-General"s Council
explanation_html: • A law member was to appointed but not an Indian. First law member appointed under this Charter Act, 1833 was Lord Macaulay.

question_html: With reference to colonial rule in India, what was sought by the Ilbert Bill in 1883?
option_a: (a)  To bring Indians and Europeans on par as far as the criminal jurisdiction of courts was concerned
option_b: (b)  To impose severe restrictions on the freedom of the native press as it was perceived to be hostile to colonial rulers
option_c: (c)  To encourage the native Indians to appear for civil service examinations by conducting them in India
option_d: (d)  To allow native Indians to posses arms by amending the Arms Act
explanation_html: • To bring Indians and Europeans on par as far as the criminal jurisdiction of court was concerned. The controversy of Ilbert Bill was that, it proposed to give the Indian Judges the right to ……..trial Europeans also. It was introduced during Lord Rippon period and was repealed later.

question_html: An important aspect of the Cripps Mission of 1942 was
option_a: (a)  That all Indian States should join the Indian Union as a condition to consider any degree of autonomy for India
option_b: (b)  The creation of an Indian Union with Dominion status very soon after the Second World War
option_c: (c)  The active participation and cooperation of the Indian people, communities and political parties in the British war effort as a condition for granting independence with full sovereign status to India after war
option_d: (d)  The framing of a constitution for the entire Indian Union, with no separate constitution for any province, and a Union Constitution to be accepted by all provinces
explanation_html: • The Cripps Mission was sent during World War-II after the August offer was rejected, to get the full support of Indians for the British in their war efforts. The important aspect was the creation of an Indian Union with dominion status very soon after the Second World War.

question_html: When Congress leaders condemned the Montague-Chelmsford Report, many moderates left the party to form the
explanation_html: • ‘Indian Liberal Federation’ was formed by the moderates who left the Congress Party after Montford report. Among them prominent member was Surendranath Banerjee.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. Molasses is a by-product of sugar production process.

2. Bagasse obtained in the sugar mills is used as a fuel in the boilers to generate steam for the sugar factories.

3. Sugar can only be produced from sugarcane as the raw material.

Which of these statements are correct?
explanation_html: Statements 1 and 3 are correct. But Third statement is wrong. Because Sugar can be produced from Sugarbeet (Beta vulgaris) also. Sugarbeet is the major contributor for world’s guar production than Sugarcane.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is correct?
option_a: (a)  Alliance Air is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Indian Airlines
option_b: (b)  The Airports Authority of India manages seven of the country’s international airports
option_c: (c)  The Airports Authority of India is the regulatory organization for enforcing civil air regulations in India
option_d: (d)  It is the function of Directorate General of Civil Aviation to plan and construct runways and terminal buildings and to provide air safety services
explanation_html:
b, c, d statements are wrong.
 The Airports Authority of India (AAI) manages 126 air ports, including 11 international, 86 domestic airports and 29 civil enclaves at defence air fields. AAI plans, develops constructs and maintains runways, taxiways, apron, terminal building etc. (it is not the function of DG of Civil Aviation) Director General of Civil Aviation is the regulatory body for enforcing Civil air regulations in India.

question_html:
Consider the following animals of India:

1. Crocodile

2. Elephant

Which of these is/are endangered species?
explanation_html: Both Crocodile and Elephant are endangered species. In order to protect these species, crocodile breeding project and project elephant were launched in 1974 and 1992 respectively.

question_html: Which one of the following is produced during the formation of photochemical smog?
explanation_html: The deep reddish brown NO2 (Nitrogen oxide) gas, which is the only widely prevalent coloured pollutant gas is the chief constituent of Photochemical Smog, in metropolitan areas.

question_html: In which one of the following countries is Rupee its currency?
explanation_html:
Seychelles currency is Rupee.
 Bhutan’s currency is Ngultrum.
 Malaysia’s currency is Ringgit.
 Maldives currency is Rufiyaa.

question_html: Which one among the following languages has largest number of speakers in the world?
explanation_html: (In the given optional) Bengali has largest number of speakers in the world i.e. 207 million, French – 79 million speakers, Japanese – 125 million speakers, Portuguese – 176 million speakers.

question_html: Who headed the Interim Cabinet formed in the year 1946?
explanation_html: The Interim Cabinet, that was announced on August 24, 1946, having 12 members, was added by Pandit Nehru as the Vice-President of the Council.

question_html: Among the following commodities imported by India during the year 2000-01, which one was the highest in terms of Rupee value?
explanation_html: Pearls, precious and semi precious stones were the highest in rupee value imported during the year 2000-01 which was about 8.3 percent of total imports.

question_html: With reference to India, which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_a: (a)  IPCL is India’s largest petrochemical company
option_b: (b)  RIL is the largest private sector company in India
option_c: (c)  MTNL is the listed on NYSE
option_d: (d)  BSNL is the first telecom service organization in India to launch a nationwide cellular service at one time
explanation_html: IPCL is not India’s largest petro-chemical company. Recently, it was taken over by RIL (Reliance Industries Limited).

question_html: The Kelkar proposals which were in the news recently were the:
option_a: (a)  Recommendations for reforms in the power sector
option_c: (c)  Guidelines for the privatization of public sector undertakings
option_d: (d)  Guidelines for reducing vehicular pollution, and the promotion of CNG use
explanation_html: Kelkar proposals were in news for giving recommendations for tax reforms. Some of its proposals were the abolition of MAT, to increase the Service tax and to decrease Corporate tax from 36.5% to 30%.

question_html: Which one among the following countries has the lowest GDP per capita?
explanation_html: India has the lowest GDP per capita compared to Sri Lanka, China and Indonesia.

question_html: As per the Human Development Index given by UNDP, which one of the following sequences of South Asian countries is correct, in the order of higher to lower development?
explanation_html: HDI given by UNDP is in the order of Sri Lanka, Maldives, India and Pakistan with ranks 99, 104, 127 and 144 respectively in 2001.

question_html:
Assertion (A): The weight of a body decreases with the increase of latitude on earth.

Reason (R): The earth is not a perfect sphere.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: The value of ‘g’ on the earth is highest at poles and lowest at the equator. Thus the value of ‘g’ increases as were more from equator to the pole (i.e. increase of latitude from 00 to 900). Therefore the weight (W = mg) also increase with increase in latitude. The Earth is not a perfect sphere. It is flattered at poles (900 latitude) and bulges out at the equator (00 latitude).

question_html: If the radius of the earth were to shrink by one per cent, its mass remaining the same, the value of ‘g’ on the earth’s surface would .
A hydrogen-inflated polythene balloon is released from the surface of the earth. As the balloon rises to an altitude up in the atmosphere, it will.
option_d: (d)  Maintain the same size and shape
explanation_html: Hydrogen inflated polythene balloon will maintain the same size and shape as polythene balloons will not expand with rise in altitude up in the atmosphere.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. Steam at 1000C and boiling water at 1000C contain same amount of heat.

2. Latent heat of fusion of ice is equal to the latent heat of vaporization of water.

3. In an air-conditioners, heat is extracted from the room-air at the evaporator coils and is rejected out at the condenser coils.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: Steam at 1000C contain more amount of heat than boiling water at 1000C. Latent heat of fusion of ice (80 cal/g) is less than latent heat of vaporization of water (536 cal/g).

question_html: Diffusion of light in the atmosphere takes place due to
explanation_html: Diffusion of light in the atmosphere takes place due to dust particles.

question_html: An oil tanker is partially filled with oil and moves forward on a level road with uniform acceleration. The free surface of oil then.
option_b: (b)  Is inclined to the horizontal with smaller depth at the rear and
option_c: (c)  Is inclined to the horizontal with larger depth at the rear and
explanation_html: The free surface of oil then is inclined to the horizontal with larger depth at the rear end.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_a: (a)  The velocity of sound in air increases with the increase of temperature
option_b: (b)  The velocity of sound in air is independent of pressure
option_c: (c)  The velocity of sound in air decreases as the humidity increases
option_d: (d)  The velocity of sound in air is not affected by the change in amplitude and frequency
explanation_html: The velocity of sound in air increases with the increase in humidity percentage.

question_html:
With reference to ionic compounds, consider the following statements”

1. Ionic compounds are insoluble in alcohol.

2. Ionic compounds in the solid state are good conductors of electricity.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: Ionic compounds are highly soluble in water but are not soluble in organic solvents like alcohol, ether, acetone etc. Ionic compounds are good conductors in soluble state because of availability of free ions.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_a: (a)  The presence of NaCl increases the rate of setting of Plaster of Paris
option_b: (b)  Gypsum is added to the cement to slow down its rate of setting
option_c: (c)  All alkaline earth metals form hydrated salts
option_d: (d)  Barium and Strontium are found free in nature
explanation_html: Gypsum is used for making ‘Plaster of Paris’. It is prepared by heating Gypsum at 390 K. So the statement ‘Presence of NaCl increases the rate of setting of Plaster of Paris is not correct.

question_html: Regarding the atom of a chemical element, the magnetic quantum number refers to
explanation_html:
The Magnetic Quantum number (m1)  Orientation of the orbital
 Principal Quantum number (n)  Size of the orbital
 Azimuthal Quantum number (l)  Shape of the orbital
 Spin Quantum number (m5)  Spin of the orbital

question_html:
Assertion (A): In the periodic table of chemical elements, electron affinity is always found to increase from top to bottom in a group.

Reason (R): In a group, the atomic radii generally increase from top to bottom.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: Electron affinity of chemical elements is found to decrease from top to bottom in a group in the periodic table. The atomic radii in a group generally increase from top to bottom.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is correct?
option_a: (a)  Liquid Sodium is employed as a coolant in nuclear reactors
option_b: (b)  Calcium carbonate is an ingredient of tooth paste
option_c: (c)  Bordeaux mixture consists of Sodium sulphate and lime
option_d: (d)  Zinc amalgams are used as a dental filling
explanation_html: Liquid sodium is employed as a coolant in nuclear reactors. Bordeaux mixture consists of copper sulphate and lime. Tin amalgams are used as dental filling especially with gold and silver. Calcium Carbonate, Silica and Triclosan are key ingredients in Tooth Paste.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

The purpose of adding sodium sulphate and sodium silicate to the detergent in a washing powder is

1. To keep the washing powder dry.

2. To maintain the alkalinity of the powder.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html:
Hydrated Sodium Carbonate is called Washing Soda (Na2CO3.10H2O). Sodium Silicate is a drying agent and so used for keeping washing powder dry. It is Sodium Carbonate which on hydrolysis gives alkaline solution:
 NA2CO3 + H2O → NaHCO3 + NaOH

question_html: Octopus is.
explanation_html: Octopus is a mollusk with eight equal arms comes under class cephalopoda and order octopoda.

question_html:
Consider the following conditions of a sick human body:

1. Swollen lymph nodes

2. Sweating at night

3. Loss of memory

4. Loss of weight

Which of these are symptoms of AIDS?
explanation_html:
Acquired Immuno Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS) caused by HIV, a retrovirus is a fatal disease in which immune system of the body is seriously affected.
 Symptoms:
1. Swollen lymph nodes.
2. Sweating at night.
3. Loss of weight.
4. Loss of memory.
5. Decreased count of blood platelets causing haemorrhage and fever and
6. Susceptibility to other infectious due to breakdown of immune system.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. The common blue green algae, Spirogyra and Ulothrix and found in both fresh after ponds and oceans.

2. The chameleon can look ahead with one eye, and at the same time look behind with another.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html:
Blue green algae (cyanobacteria) found in fresh water, brackish water and salt water.
 Spirogyra (green algae) common in fresh water habitats.
 Ulothrix (green algae) found in fresh and marine water habitats.
 The eyes of chameleon (Chameleon calcaratus) are elevated in small cones and can move in all directions and each eye can see independently of the other.

question_html:
Assertion (A): Unsaturated fats are more reactive compared with the saturated fats.

Reason (R): Unsaturated fats have only single bond in their structure.
option_a: (a)  Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_b: (b)  Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
option_c: (c)  A is true but R is false
option_d: (d)  A is false but R is true
explanation_html: • Along with single bonds, unsaturated fats have double and triple bonds, that’s why they are more reactive compared to saturated fats.

question_html:
With reference to the work of human kidney, consider the following statements:

1. After the waste is removed in the kidney, the cleaner blood is sent back through renal artery.

2. From Bowman’s capsule, the filtered liquid passes through tiny tubes where much of the glucose is reabsorbed and sent back to the blood in the renal vein.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: After the waste is removed in the kidney, the cleaner blood is sent back through renal vein.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_a: (a)  Milk contains none of the B-vitamins
option_b: (b)  Vitamin-A (retinol) deficiency leads to dry and scaly skin
option_c: (c)  One of the symptoms of scurvy is pain in the joints
option_d: (d)  Vitamin B1 (thiamine) deficiency can lead to heart failure
explanation_html: Milk contains B-complex vitamins viz. Thiamine (B1), Riboflavin (B2), Pyridoxine phosphate (B6), Cyanocobalamine (B12) etc.

question_html:
With reference to normal human beings, consider the following statements:

1. In response to the presence of HCl, secretin is produced from the duodenum.

2. Enterogastrone is produced in the small intestine in response to the presence of fatty acids?

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html:
‘Secretin’ is produced from the S-cells of duodenum in response to the presence of HCl (pH < 4.5). It helps in increasing water and bicarbonate secretion from pancreas and bile ducts.
 Enterogastrone is secreted from intestinal mucosa and is stimulated on exposure of duodenal mucosa to dietary lipids. It inhibits gastric secretion.

question_html:
Consider the following statements:

1. India launched its first full-fledged meteorological satellite (METSAT) in September, 2002.

2. For the first time, the space vehicle PSLV-C4 carried a payload of more than 1000 kg into a geosynchronous orbit.

Which of these statements is/are correct?
explanation_html: METSAT also called KALPANA-I named after India born American Space Astronaut ‘Kalpana Chawla’ was launched by PSLV in September, 2002.

question_html: With reference to Indian defence, which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_a: (a)  With the induction of Prithvi-II, the IAF is the only air force in the world with surface-to-surface ballistic missiles under its command
option_b: (b)  Sukhoi-30 KMI jet fighters can launch air-to-air and air-to-surface precision missiles

explanation_html: Trishul is a short range (500m to 9km) surface to air missile with solid composite propellant and dual thrust motor and command to line- of sight guidance.

question_html: Which one of the following statements is correct?
